metadata.name: BloodHound Collection Files
metadata.comment: Detects default file names outputted by the BloodHound collection tool SharpHound

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND (endswith(lower(file.path), lower('bloodhound.zip')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('_computers.json')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('_containers.json')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('_domains.json')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('_gpos.json')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('_groups.json')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('_ous.json')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('_users.json'))) AND NOT (endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\svchost.exe')) AND startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\program files\\windowsapps\\microsoft.')) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\pocket_containers.json'))))

output.summary: Detects default file names outputted by the BloodHound collection tool SharpHound

metadata.objective: False positive: Some false positives may arise in some environment and this may require some tuning. Add additional filters or reduce level depending on the level of noise Reference: https://academy.hackthebox.com/course/preview/active-directory-bloodhound/bloodhound--data-collection
